metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8953 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
fs/overlayfs/copy_up.c in the Linux kernel before 4.2.6 uses an incorrect cleanup code path, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (dentry reference leak) via filesystem operations on a large file in a lower overlayfs layer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8953` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-19-generic - 4.2.0-19.23
linux-image-4.2.0-19-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-19.23
linux-image-4.2.0-19-lowlatency - 4.2.0-19.23
linux-image-4.2.0-19-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-19.23
linux-image-4.2.0-19-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-19.23
linux-image-4.2.0-19-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-19.23
linux-image-4.2.0-19-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-19.23
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-19-generic - 4.2.0-19.23
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support
